oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Judge Alfred Thompson Adams, 1980 September 16, excerpt 09
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville lawyer and judge Alfred Thompson Adams, conducted on 16 September 1980 by Leanne Thornton as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. 1910-1935 Oral History Project. Adams, who served Nashville as Chancellor of Part Two of the Davidson County Chancery Court from 1957 to 1970, discusses traveling to Beersheba Springs during the summers. He also discusses the history of Beersheba Springs, which was incorporated by the Tennessee General Assembly and recognized as a summer resort in 1839. The Beersheba Springs Historic District was placed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1980. The complete interview is available in the repository.
